Fields.DialogueText: Shropshire, we need to talk.
Hm? What is it, Cap?
You requisitioned a lot of scrap wood...
That's right, Captain.
And six cans of paint, decidedly not medium gray...
Aye...?
And half a dozen cans of varnish...
You sound like you don't approve.

Fields.MenuText: It's a lot of material. What are you planning?
We can't take on this much cargo for frivolous reasons.
Why didn't you ask me before putting in the order?

Fields.DialogueText: Can't tell you yet. It's a surprise.
A bit of a morale boost, what!
Morale is NOT frivolous, Captain!
Nevertheless...
Because it's a surprise for you and the crew.
Telling you would spoil the fun.
If my ship's Belle is going to start such a big project, I'd like to know what it is.
Well, if you insist, of course I'll show you--
*ALARM*
... after we deal with these bloody Morgs.
@BATTLE
It's hot down here in the magazine!
Can't be helped. We're right next to the boilers.
That's a lot of strange, lumpy boxes you've got there. Why are they covered in cloth?
Not boxes, Skipper! I'll just take this cloth off, and... voila!
A big wooden moon... wooden cutouts of trees... and this... what is this?
It's going to be a palace, as soon as I get my paint.
You requisitioned all that paint and wood for these?
'Course, Skipper! You can't have a forest without trees, can you? It could be Arden or Athens, but it needs to be a forest.

Fields.MenuText: Arden and Athens... you're referencing Shakespeare, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Right on. I want to put on A Midsummer Night's Dream.
One of my favourite plays by one of my favourite playwrights.

Fields.MenuText: So you made all these yourself? With things we already had aboard?

Fields.DialogueText: Indeed I did!
What kind of country girl would I be if I couldn't even pull off a little light carpentry?

Fields.MenuText: How many trees do you need?

Fields.DialogueText: You've already got five or six!
It's an enchanted forest, not an enchanted thicket!
You see why I need all this wood and paint, Captain?
Yes. You're planning to put on a play.
With a captain as clever as you, this war will be over in two shakes of a lamb's tail.
Flattery will get you nowhere.
Fine. But can I--?
*ALARM*
I'll think about it. For now, let's get these Morganas.
Aye-aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Shropshire, I talked to the quartermaster...
About my props?
Mmhm. He says that we can make the space for more, if...

Fields.MenuText: ... you keep it all out of the way.
... you do all your painting on the deck.
... you give him a part in the play.

Fields.DialogueText: There's still some room in my cabin!
Course I can do that. Don't want anyone choking on fumes, what!
Oh, is that all? He'd make a fantastic Bottom, wouldn't he?
... I'm just going to pretend you didn't say that.
Thank you, Captain! Thank you so much!
Whoa!
*CRASH*
Ow!
Sorry, Cap-- are you all right?
You hug like a bear!
Guess I don't know my own strength!
My ribs sure do...
*ALARM*
Are you going to be able to fight? Do I need to take you to the infirmary?
I'm - ack! I'm fine, Shrop. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Three... two... one... GO!
What's going on? I heard a lot of noise.
Wheelbarrow races!
Uh...
The play's nowhere near ready and the crew's been getting restless. And you don't need any gear to race!
So what do you say, Cap? Are you in?

Fields.MenuText: Sure, why not? Just let me roll up my sleeves...
On the deck of a moving ship? Seems dangerous.
Nope. No way. Not doing it.

Fields.DialogueText: Fantastic!
Oh, don't be a worrywart! It'll be fun.
If you say so...
C'mon, Skipper. The crew should see their captain having fun once in a while!
Yes, but this won't be fun.
*ALARM*
Looks like we'll have to finish this after the battle. To arms, everyone!
Does she ever rest?
I'm starting to think she doesn't know the meaning of the word...
@BATTLE
Feeding Sarah again?
'Course. She's been giving me sad eyes all morning.
Look at the sad eyes. Look at them!
You really love that cat, don't you?
Of course! She's a darling. Aren't you, Sarah? Who's an ickle dear?
Prrt...
She's a spoiled darling.
Is not.
When you love someone, you do everything you can to take care of them, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Of course, but...
You need to take care of yourself first. Can't fill a bucket from an empty well.
Is that why you're so worried about crew morale?

Fields.DialogueText: No buts about it! We look after our own.
I guess that's true...
Sure is.
As this ship's Lady, I have a duty to my crew, just as you do!
I was just coming to tell you...
I already fed Sarah this morning.
Sarah! You naughty little thing!
Mrrrow!
Shall we escort this little criminal to the brig?
*ALARM*
I swear, the Morganas are needier than Sarah...
@BATTLE
So, Shrop, what are you reading?
On the Origin of Species. Got it on our last shore leave.
Huh. I didn't think that'd be your first choice.
What? Why?

Fields.MenuText: I didn't think you'd be much of a reader...
I didn't know you were a scientist!
Do you think it'll give us an advantage against the Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a country girl, not the village idiot.
No, that's not - you're a Belle of action, that's all!
Well, I wouldn't go that far, but I think it's interesting.
The way every creature adapts to its place in the world? It's fascinating!
Not everything in life is about war, Skipper!
Did you know Charles Darwin was from Salopia? That makes him my countryman.
Salopia?
It's the Latin name for Shropshire. My mates call me Salop.
It's got a nice ring to it.
Thanks, Cap. We are mates, aren't we?
Of course... Salop.
*ALARM*
Shall we naturally select these Morganas?
Right behind you.
@BATTLE
... and that's all you need to do!
I don't know, Miss... what if people laugh at me?
Poppycock! You'll be fantastic, Ica! Besides, it's a comedy. They'll be laughing with you.
Th-that's what I'm afraid of!
Salop? A word?
What is it, Cap?
I know you'd like your mates to join in on the play, but...

Fields.MenuText: Don't harass my crew. She doesn't want to act, so don't make her.
We both know Ica's shy. I think you're scaring her.
Look, a distraction!

Fields.DialogueText: Where... Oh. Very funny, Skipper.
I'm not trying to scare her. She'd make a perfect Hermia!
I wasn't harassing her, I was trying to get her out of her shell!
Ica would be a wonderful actor. She just needs a little nudge.
I had to help her get away somehow...
... and I'm telling you, you can't be the one to give her that nudge.
Understand?
*ALARM*
Yes, Captain. Let's go get 'em.
@BATTLE
Salop? Are you down in the magazine?
Catch!
Augh! Why did you throw a towel at my face?
It's not a towel, Skipper, it's a toga! Try it on.
Uhhhhh--
If you don't like the toga, I've got a few flower fairy costumes. Or maybe a sheep?
We have a meeting this afternoon. Did you forget?
... Maybe. But can't you try it on before the meeting?

Fields.MenuText: It'd be unprofessional.
I really can't show up to a meeting as a flower fairy...
Well, if you insist...

Fields.DialogueText: You won't have to wear it TO the meeting! Unless you want to, but--
Good show, Captain!
You can change back before you go. It'll be the work of a moment!
*ALARM*
... Don't suppose you'd want to fight the Morgs as a flower fairy?
Hah! Let's go.
@BATTLE
Say, Chujiro - I know you help the mechanics a lot, right?
I wouldn't say that... I'm an amateur.
But you're good at it, aren't you?
Well...
I'd love it if you could help with the lights. And the special effects!
Well...
Salop?

Fields.MenuText: Are you badgering the crew again?
What's this I hear about special effects?
Don't you have anything else to be doing?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not like that, Captain. I want to be part of the play, just--
I want to make our fairies fly! I'm sure we can find material for harnesses, and if we have enough technically-minded crew--
Negative, Cap! Cat's been fed, deck's been scrubbed, powder's dry.
*ALARM*
There goes our afternoon.
Let's talk later!
Yes, ma'am...
@BATTLE
Salop? Are you in your cabin?
Yes. Come in!
We have to talk about your maintenance repor--
Is that what I think it is?
A tiny hammock for Sarah? Yes, yes, it is.

Fields.MenuText: That's adorable.
Did you make that yourself?
I swear, that cat has a better berth than our officers.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Skipper. Doesn't she look cozy?
Of course. Nothing but the best for our ship's cat!
They can make their own hammocks, then!
*ALARM*
Here we go again...
Don't let Sarah out! Close the door behind you.
@BATTLE
Skipper! I was looking for you. Need some advice.
Oh? What is it?
I caught Chujiro looking through my costume bag earlier.
When I asked him what he was doing, he seemed embarrassed. He evaded every one of my pointed questions.
And they were the pointiest questions imaginable, Skip.
... I see...
Do you think he's a spy?

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely not. That's ridiculous.
If he was a spy, wouldn't he be snooping around something more... critical?
Maybe he's just tired of the mandatory fun.

Fields.DialogueText: You wound me, Captain.
I suppose you're right...
How can you be so sure?
Why don't you just talk to him? Without accusations or pointed questions.
If he's a spy, I don't want to tip him off.
And on the very real chance he isn't?
... I don't want to make things... awkward...
It sounds like you already have.
*ALARM*
*sigh* ... That's my advice. Take it or leave it.
Of course, Cap. To arms?
After you.
@BATTLE
C-Captain? C-can you spare a moment?
Of course. What's on your mind?
It's about Miss Sh-Shropshire, Captain.
I think I must have d-done something to offend her. She's b-been avoiding me.
Is there any way I c-c-can apologize?

Fields.MenuText: You haven't done anything wrong, so you don't need to apologize.
Shropshire needs to get her act together. This isn't on you.
Is she giving you the silent treatment?

Fields.DialogueText: Then why is she upset?
You... mean it, Captain?
No, Captain. She's just b-been avoiding me. Staying out of my way.
*ALARM*
*sigh*
Thank you for letting me know about this. I'll take care of it.
Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Ah, Captain! I've been looking for you--
I've been looking for *you*. What's wrong?
You still don't have a costume.
A costume?
For the play, you goose.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not going to be in the play, so I don't need a costume.
We need to talk about how you've been treating the crew.
Please listen to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be a wet blanket, Cap.
Anyway, I think you'd look great in a toga...
Perhaps Bottom's costume?
An ass's head sure suits you..
Maybe something like a uniform?
You know, I've never seen you in civvies...
Salop. You *need* to talk to your... cast. Especially Chujiro and Ica.
You can't keep avoiding them forever.
What makes you think I've been avoiding them?
*ALARM*
And now we've got bigger things to worry about.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
Salop? You've been spending a lot of time in your cabin...
I've been reading.
You sure you're not avoiding people?
Absolutely. Origin of the Species is wonderful. I can't put it down!
Really?
I think it's fascinating.
Did you know there are finches in the Galapagos with beaks made to eat just one kind of insect?
They've adapted so well to their lives that they couldn't do anything else.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think people are like that too?
Aren't there some problems with Darwin's theories?
What's so important about finches?

Fields.DialogueText: If you mean "did humans evolve," yes. If you mean individual people...
Some folks are good at adapting to new situations. Some aren't. It's like any other talent.
Well, he's not the most up-to-date source, no. But it's always good to look back at the past.
They're a demonstration of the theory, Skipper.
The way they look and act proves that they evolved.
... Say... where's Sarah? She was just in here a minute ago. Did you let her out?
I didn't see her...
*ALARM*
You can look for your cat after we beat the Morganas.
Aye-aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
*CRASH*
Salop, what are you doing?
Looking for Sarah.
Finding a cat shouldn't mean knocking over all your props! That's four trees and six ammo crates!
She's been missing for three days.

Fields.MenuText: There's only so many places she could have gone. We'll find her.
Maybe she fell overboard?
I don't mind if you look for Sarah, but don't tear my ship apart to find her!

Fields.DialogueText: Then where is she? I've looked everywhere!
Don't even joke about that!
It's as much my ship as it is yours!
*ALARM*
AUGH! One thing after another!
She'll turn up sooner or later. For now-
Yes, yes, Morganas. Forgive me, Cap.
@BATTLE
And you can't just... sense her? You can find crew members just by concentrating on them, right? The ship's mascot must count as crew.
Sarah's much better at hiding than the other crew. Even Ica.
You've been in your cabin all day. Weren't you going to look for Sarah?
Go away.
What's gotten into you?
You don't understand.
Try me.
I insulted Chujiro. Ica is scared to talk to me. And now Sarah ran away.
Everyone hates me, even the cat.

Fields.MenuText: I don't hate you. You're our Belle!
Did they tell you they hate you?
Cats aren't people.

Fields.DialogueText: That's kind of you, but isn't it my job to be your Belle?
Not in so many words, no...
But if you had to spend the next six months on a ship with someone, would you tell them you hate them?
If Sarah hated you, she'd leave a present in your shoe.
Hah! You may be right...
I can understand why you're upset. But I promise, they're not trying to freeze you out.
You got yourself into an awkward situation. It happens to all of us. But now you have to adapt.
If you're going to be a leader - whether you're a captain or a director - you have to adapt to awkward situations like this.
You have to figure out what your people need and change to suit it.
Using my own words against me, Skipper? That's cruel.
What can I say? I'm a mean, mean person.
Will beating some Morganas help your mood?
You always know how to make me feel better...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
If another Morgana rears her head before we find Sarah, I'll turn her into cat food!
You'd do that anyway!
@BATTLE
Thanks for talking Cook into letting us search the mess.
You're welcome. Hmm... no sign of her in the mess hall...

Fields.MenuText: Go check the galley cabinets.
Check the cupboard under the sink.
Give the pantry a quick look.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye-aye!
Right on, Skipper.
You got it.
Oh! Come look!
What? What is it?
Mew....
You found Sarah!
Not just her. Look!
Is that a kitten?!
Three kittens!
... Of course. Last time we got on shore leave, the port was full of stray cats.
A tom must have gotten aboard. And you know how cats are...
She was just hiding because she... needed some time.
You see, Salop? Kittens don't hate you.
All right, all right, you've made your point! But...
Thanks. I needed that.
No problem.
You look cozy with all those cats in your lap.
Looks can be deceiving. I'm a prisoner!
Is that so?
Sarah and her babies have been on my lap for hours. My legs are asleep, and I desperately need a cuppa.
But if I get up, I'll wake them up! You see the problem.
Truly, a knot not even Alexander could cut. So what will you do with your new free time?
I'm writing my sisters a letter. Once the kits are older, maybe they can take one home.
That's a good idea. One big, happy family.
Mm-hm! I've also been thinking--
*ALARM*
Rats!
Sorry, babies, up you get.
Say, if we put a kitten on top of the Morganas, do you think they'll hold still?

Fields.MenuText: That'd be cruel to the cat.
Probably not.
Just give me the word...

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, I'd never hurt our little mates like that.
The fiends!
Wait, wait, wait, that was a joke!
All right, all right. Let's make this battle quick and cat-free.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
So, before that last Morgana attack, I was thinking...
Hm?
About what you said - with my cast. I think I've figured out a plan of attack.

Fields.MenuText: Whoa, whoa, you're not going to attack the crew, are you?
A plan? Like calling Chujiro a spy?
What's the plan, Salop?

Fields.DialogueText: I was just getting to that.
'Course not! It was a figure of speech.
Dear God, no! That was a terrible idea.
I wanted to protect the crew. But you were dead on, Cap. I was so keen on helping with morale...
I forgot to ask 'em what they needed. So...
I'm going to talk to the folks I've wronged and apologise. I'd like you to come along, for... moral support.
And then what?
And then I'm going to adapt. I'll give them what they tell me they need, not what I think they need.
That sounds like a fantastic plan. Let's get on it--
*ALARM*
.... after we deal with the bloody Morganas.
@BATTLE
Private Umarputri? Miss Shropshire would like a word.
O-oh...
Come now, Cap. There's no need to be so formal.
Ica... I wanted to say... I'm sorry. I shouldn't have pushed you to act so hard.
I was bossy and rude. Can you forgive me?
Of c-course, ma'am.
... Captain, what do I do now?

Fields.MenuText: Ask her how you can make it up to her.
Ask her what she wants.
I'm not your mother. You can figure this out without whispering.

Fields.DialogueText: How can I make it up to you?
What do you want to do from now on? Do you want me to leave you alone?
Helpful as ever, huh...
Well... the thing is... um... I want to help with the p-play!
You do?!
Yes. Just- b-backstage. What do you call it - a stagehand?
Yes! We still need lots of backstage help. Do you want to help with costumes or special effects?
Umm....
*ALARM*
We've got them coming and going today, don't we?
@BATTLE
Time to talk to Chujiro. Are you ready?

Fields.MenuText: I was born ready!
This is your party. I'm just along for the ride.
Let's do this.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the spirit.
Here he comes...
You're wonderful at this moral support thing, Captain.
Miss Shropshire? I need to apologize--
Oh, Chujiro! I wanted to say sorry for--
Hey, hey, one at a time!
I was wrong to shout at you. I shouldn't have accused you of things for no reason.
I shouldn't have gone through your costume bag without permission. It was childish of me.
I just wanted to try on one of the fairy costumes without making a scene.
It wouldn't have been anything of the sort!
Men don't normally dress as fairies, do they...?
There are loads of male fairies in this play. The fairies have a king, and one of the most important characters in the play is a male fairy!
Now that I think about it... we still don't have an actor to play him.
Would you let me? Please??
You WANT to be in the play? Next you're going to tell me you miss the wheelbarrow races.
I do! They were so much fun.
When will you do another one?
*ALARM*
Now that crew morale's back up, let's get back to what we do best.
@BATTLE
These costumes look great, Salop!
Between your games, your cat training, and our Morgana fights, I don't know where you get the time to make them all.
I don't sleep much, Skipper!
Well, you did good work when you weren't sleeping. Everyone in the crew is just amazed.
... Even you?
Well... at first, I thought...

Fields.MenuText: ... they were a bit silly.
... they were a distraction from important things.
... I didn't have enough free time even to form an opinion.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course they're silly. That's the point!
It's important to keep your chin up, Skipper.
I understand, Skipper. It's been a rough few weeks.
That's what I thought at first. But they've grown on me.
Huh, really?
Yes. They really give the ship character.
In that case...
*ALARM*
Seems like the Morganas never sleep either, huh?
Seems so, yeah....
@BATTLE
The whole ship is buzzing! Everyone's so excited for the play.
Well, the night of the dress rehearsal is always exciting!
It's got a special energy to it. Just like the night before a race.
You can say that again.
Just like the night before a race!
Ugh... I walked right into that one.
Oh, I almost forgot! This is for you.
Is that... a costume?
Mm-hm. I know you said you didn't want one at first, but ... you said they'd grown on you. So I made you a pirate costume out of an old uniform.
Salop, I...

Fields.MenuText: I don't know what to say!
It's wonderful! Thank you.
Aw, you shouldn't have...

Fields.DialogueText: Then don't say anything - I'll come hug you!
It was nothin', Skipper!
Least I could do for my captain.
No, really... you shouldn't have...
*ALARM*
You're still looking out for us, huh? I guess some things never change.
Ah, damn. You jinxed us!
@BATTLE
On your left!
Oh, Chujiro! Don't forget your hat.
Thanks! You're so good at keeping track of all this - I could never handle it.
Sh-shucks, it's my j-job.
Those two work really well together, don't they?
Like a well-oiled machine.
We owe it to you, Skipper. Without your help, none of this would have happened.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I don't want to brag...
You did all the work. I just nudged you the right way.
Oh, don't be silly...

Fields.DialogueText: Silliness is good for the soul.
There's no need to be modest, Captain.
Then don't.
Anyway. Good luck tonight!
Agh! Don't say that!
What? Why not?
Wishing actors good luck before they tread the boards is BAD luck! Say "break a leg", or--
*ALARM*
You think that's our bad luck?
Got it in one, mate.
@BATTLE
Oh! Pardon me, Captain! Ma'am!
Morganas! Let's drive them away and get back to the play!
@BATTLE
If we shadows have offended, think but this, and all is mended...
Morganas or no, I think that went well.
You're a good director.
And you're a flatterer.
I mean it.
Give me your hands if we be friends, and Robin shall restore amends.
*CHEERING*
Whoa, they really loved it!
Guess we'll put on another play soon, then. Will you join in?
Maybe. Will it be more Shakespeare?
Depends. If it was, who would you want to play?

Fields.MenuText: We could do Hamlet and Horatio. They were true friends.
Romeo and Juliet. Classic star-crossed lovers.

Fields.DialogueText: Might be bad luck. Their story ended so badly.
Ours won't.
How can you be so sure?
We've got the most adaptable Belle in the fleet on our side. No matter what you stumble into... you'll be able to handle it.
